title: 106_s2821
content: The Act may be cited as the "FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000". It addresses the creditability of service. The "FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2000" amends Section 8411(b) of title 5, United States Code to include service as a temporary or intermittent employee for the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation between December 31, 1988, and June 30, 2000, of at least 1 year's duration for credit purposes under this chapter. The amendment requires employees or Members to deposit 1.3 percent of basic pay for service performed under a retirement system established by US law. Deposits made more than 5 years later must include interest. The deposit is due and must include interest, compounded annually after 5 years. Failure to make the full deposit will result in a reduction of the annuity based on the employee's service. SEC. 3. PROVISIONS RELATING TO PERSONS WHO HAVE SEPARATED. The Office of Personnel Management will prescribe regulations for obtaining credit for service performed by individuals who have separated from Government service. Credit will only be given if a written application is submitted by December 31, 2001. Any annuity or survivor annuity will be recomputed to include the service described in the regulations. The Office of Personnel Management will prescribe regulations for obtaining credit for service performed by individuals who have separated from Government service. Credit will only be given if a written application is submitted by December 31, 2001. An appropriate reduction will be made in the recomputed annuity if the full deposit required is not timely made. Interest is not included in any deposit under this subsection. The Office of Personnel Management will inform individuals of their rights under the Act and assist in obtaining necessary information from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. The Corporation must provide information on an individual's service upon request from the Office.
